task.title: Taking Hydrometer Readings
task.shortdesc: Check battery charge status every two weeks by taking hydrometer readings of the electrolyte solution.

context.p: Regular hydrometer readings help ensure the generator is properly charging the battery.

step.cmd: Remove the filling plug from one cell.
step.info: Only remove one plug at a time.

step.cmd: Insert the hydrometer syringe into the filler tube.
Draw up enough solution to float the glass bulb inside the instrument.
Read the scale at the surface of the liquid.
step.info:
Refer to the following image for the proper reading technique. Hydrometer Readings
Image of two hydrometers displaying different readings.

step.cmd: Return the electrolyte to the same cell from which it was taken.

result.p: The reading indicates the strength of the solution and the battery's charge level.
result.note: Wait for newly added water to mix thoroughly with the electrolyte before taking readings.
If the battery is less than half-charged, take it to an authorized Battery Service Station for recharging.
If readings between cells differ by more than 50 points, have the battery inspected by a qualified service technician.
